sentences.en: He broke his leg in his scramble down the wall.
sentences.cn: 他爬墙摔断了腿.

sentences.en: He made shift to scramble up its sides.
sentences.cn: 他设法从它边上爬上去.

sentences.en: I'll scramble some eggs with roe?
sentences.cn: 我用鱼籽炒几个鸡蛋好 吗 ?

sentences.en: In our code we scramble letters, so words are unrecognisable.
sentences.cn: 在我们的密码里我们把字母顺序打乱了, 所以里面的单词是无法辨认的.

sentences.en: It was a long scramble to the top of the hill.
sentences.cn: 到山顶须要爬登一段长路.

sentences.en: It was Arakanese who joined the general scramble for loot.
sentences.cn: 阿拉干参与了对战利品的全面掠夺.

sentences.en: It's quite a scramble to get to the mountaintop.
sentences.cn: 费劲攀登才能到达山顶.

sentences.en: Make the toast and scramble the eggs.
sentences.cn: 把面包烤一下并炒些鸡蛋。

sentences.en: More than three million fans are expected to scramble for tickets.
sentences.cn: 预计会有超过300万的球迷抢购门票。

sentences.en: Our conversation will be electronically scrambled.
sentences.cn: 我们的对话将被加以电子扰频。

sentences.en: She managed to scramble out of the vehicle as it burst into flames.
sentences.cn: 车子一下子起火了，她设法从里面爬了出来。

sentences.en: She managed to scramble over the wall.
sentences.cn: 她好不容易翻过墙。

sentences.en: The three boys began to scramble up.
sentences.cn: 三个男孩开始向上登攀.

sentences.en: The village was a 20-minute scramble away.
sentences.cn: 村子离这里有20分钟的攀登路程。

sentences.en: The words in each sentence are scrambled.
sentences.cn: 每个句子中的词语都被打乱了。

sentences.en: There was an undignified scramble for the best seats.
sentences.cn: 大家争抢最好的位子，真是有失体统。

sentences.en: They can frighten you, scramble your brains, make you tremble.
sentences.cn: 他们可以恐吓你, 打破你的脑袋, 使你胆战心惊.

sentences.en: They tried to scramble up the cliff.
sentences.cn: 他们想爬上悬崖。

sentences.en: Tourists were scrambling over the rocks looking for the perfect camera angle.
sentences.cn: 旅行者们爬上岩石，寻找最完美的拍摄角度。

sentences.en: You learn to scramble and move quikly.
sentences.cn: 你要学会抢先,动作要快.

words.tran_cn: 爬行者；[电子] 扰频器；周率扰乱器
争夺；攀登；搅拌（scramble的过去分词）
抢夺，争夺；混乱，混乱的一团；爬行，攀登

trans.tran_cn: 攀登，抢夺，混乱，[航]紧急起飞
trans.tran_en: a difficult climb in which you have to use your hands to help you
to climb up, down, or over something quickly and with difficulty, especially using your hands to help you
to climb up, down, or over something quickly and with difficulty, especially using your hands to help you

trans.tran_cn: 攀登，爬，争夺，抢夺，（植物）蔓延，[航]紧急起飞
trans.tran_en: to climb up, down, or over something quickly and with difficulty, especially using your hands to help you
to cook an egg by mixing the white and yellow parts together and heating it in a pan
to use special equipment to mix messages, radio signals etc into a different form, so that they cannot be understood by other people without the correct equipment
